headline: S&P 500 Gains & Losses Today: Index Snaps Winning Streak Ahead of Fed Meeting
summary: The S&P 500 slipped 0.6% on Monday, May 5, 2025, breaking a nine-day winning streak ahead of this week's interest-rate decision by the Federal Open Market Committee.

content.title: S&P 500 Gains & Losses Today: Index Snaps Winning Streak Ahead of Fed Meeting
content.summary: The S&P 500 slipped 0.6% on Monday, May 5, 2025, breaking a nine-day winning streak ahead of this week's interest-rate decision by the Federal Open Market Committee.

headline: Skechers $9.4B deal, Tyson Foods beef, Twilio upgrade
summary: Skechers (SKX) has agreed to a $9.4 billion deal to be acquired and go private under 3G Capital. Tyson Foods (TSN) shares take a hit after the food producer missed revenue estimates in connection to declining demand in its meat product segments, namely beef. Twilio (TWLO) stock receives an upgrade to Hold by HSBC analysts, who also raised their price target on the company. To watch more expert insights and analysis on the latest market action, check out more Market Domination here.

content.title: Skechers $9.4B deal, Tyson Foods beef, Twilio upgrade
content.description:
Skechers (SKX) has agreed to a $9.4 billion deal to be acquired and go private under 3G Capital.

Tyson Foods (TSN) shares take a hit after the food producer missed revenue estimates in connection to declining demand in its meat product segments, namely beef.

Twilio (TWLO) stock receives an upgrade to Hold by HSBC analysts, who also raised their price target on the company.

To watch more expert insights and analysis on the latest market action, check out more Market Domination here.

headline: Why Tyson Foods (TSN) Stock Is Nosediving
summary: Shares of meat company Tyson Foods (NYSE:TSN) fell 9.7% in the morning session after the company reported weak first-quarter 2025 results, which included a miss on revenue and gross margin, despite beating analysts' EBITDA expectations and EPS estimates. Sales were roughly unchanged from the prior year, held back by volume declines in pork and prepared foods, though improved pricing helped cushion the blow. Looking ahead, they're expecting sales to stay flat or tick up slightly, with most of the

headline: Tyson Foods (NYSE:TSN) Sees Q2 Earnings Drop Despite Stable Sales
summary: Tyson Foods (NYSE:TSN) recently released its second quarter earnings revealing a minor sales increase, yet a stark drop in net income, which saw a decline from $145 million to $7 million. This period coincided with a 6.63% rise in Tyson's share price over the past quarter, despite broader market fluctuations amid economic uncertainties. Positive six-month results with net income growth may have cushioned the stock, while legal settlements and dividend affirmations also likely influenced...

headline: Howard Hughes stake, Tyson Foods declines, AMD earnings preview
summary: Yahoo Finance host Brad Smith tracks today's top moving stocks and biggest market stories in this Market Minute, including Bill Ackman's investment firm, Pershing Square, increasing its stake in Howard Hughes Holdings (HHH), Tyson Foods (TSN) missing revenue estimates as its meat categories see quarterly declines, and Advanced Micro Devices (AMD) is scheduled to release first quarter earnings on Tuesday, May 6. Stay up to date on the latest market action, minute-by-minute, with Yahoo Finance's Market Minute.

headline: Movie tariffs, Tyson Foods, United Airlines: Trending Tickers
summary: Brad Smith and Madison Mills outline some of today's trending tickers. US President Trump orders 100% levies on foreign-made movies. Netflix (NFLX), Disney (DIS), and Warner Bros. Discover (WBD) are under pressure after the tariff announcement. Tyson Foods (TSN) stock falls after the company reported quarterly results, which showed its chicken profits helped offset beef losses, though sales overall fell short of analyst estimates. United Airlines (UAL) cuts flights at Newark Airport as staffing shortages cause significant delays. To watch more expert insights and analysis on the latest market action, check out more Morning Brief here.

Brad Smith and Madison Mills outline some of today's trending tickers.

US President Trump orders 100% levies on foreign-made movies. Netflix (NFLX), Disney (DIS), and Warner Bros. Discover (WBD) are under pressure after the tariff announcement.

Tyson Foods (TSN) stock falls after the company reported quarterly results, which showed its chicken profits helped offset beef losses, though sales overall fell short of analyst estimates.

United Airlines (UAL) cuts flights at Newark Airport as staffing shortages cause significant delays.

headline: Tyson Foods (NYSE:TSN) Misses Q1 Revenue Estimates
summary: Meat company Tyson Foods (NYSE:TSN) missed Wall Street’s revenue expectations in Q1 CY2025, with sales flat year on year at $13.07 billion. Its non-GAAP profit of $0.92 per share was 12.2% above analysts’ consensus estimates.

content.title: Tyson Foods (NYSE:TSN) Misses Q1 Revenue Estimates
content.summary: Meat company Tyson Foods (NYSE:TSN) missed Wall Street’s revenue expectations in Q1 CY2025, with sales flat year on year at $13.07 billion. Its non-GAAP profit of $0.92 per share was 12.2% above analysts’ consensus estimates.

headline: Tyson Foods shares sink 9% as high beef prices hurt demand
summary: (Reuters) -Tyson Foods reported lower-than-expected quarterly sales and stuck to its annual revenue forecast on Monday amid weaker demand for beef, sending shares down 9% and overshadowing better-than-anticipated profits.  U.S. President Donald Trump's trade policies hung over the meat company due to concerns that tariff disputes could raise prices for a range of consumer goods and further reduce demand for pricey meat products.  Beef prices have already climbed after U.S. ranchers slashed their cattle herds due to a years-long drought that dried up pasture lands used for grazing.

content.title: Tyson Foods shares sink 9% as high beef prices hurt demand
content.summary: (Reuters) -Tyson Foods reported lower-than-expected quarterly sales and stuck to its annual revenue forecast on Monday amid weaker demand for beef, sending shares down 9% and overshadowing better-than-anticipated profits.  U.S. President Donald Trump's trade policies hung over the meat company due to concerns that tariff disputes could raise prices for a range of consumer goods and further reduce demand for pricey meat products.  Beef prices have already climbed after U.S. ranchers slashed their cattle herds due to a years-long drought that dried up pasture lands used for grazing.
